allow:
Bash(gh issue create --title "HTML export produces poor visual output" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Description

The HTML export functionality produces output that doesn''t look good visually. The exported HTML needs styling improvements to be presentable.

## Current Behavior

HTML export generates basic HTML without proper styling, resulting in:
- Poor typography and spacing
- No syntax highlighting for code blocks
- Tables lack proper formatting
- Missing or inadequate CSS styling
- Citations and references may not render nicely

## Expected Behavior

HTML export should produce clean, readable output with:
- Professional typography \(appropriate fonts, line spacing, margins\)
- Syntax highlighting for code blocks
- Properly styled tables \(borders, alternating rows, etc.\)
- Good citation/reference formatting
- Responsive layout
- Optional: Dark/light theme support

## Possible Solutions

1. Add a default CSS stylesheet bundled with exports
2. Use a CSS framework like Pico CSS or Simple.css for minimal styling
3. Add syntax highlighting via highlight.js or Prism
4. Consider Tufte CSS or similar for academic document styling
5. Allow users to specify custom CSS via `#+HTML_HEAD:` or settings

## Related

- LaTeX/PDF export works well
- This affects the standalone HTML export option
EOF
\)")

Bash(do sed -i '' 's/27-supported-languages\\.org/08-supported-languages.org/g; s/14-jupyter\\.org/09-jupyter.org/g; s/08-export\\.org/10-export.org/g; s/23-latex-preview\\.org/11-latex-preview.org/g; s/22-image-overlays\\.org/12-image-overlays.org/g; s/09-agenda\\.org/13-agenda.org/g; s/10-journal\\.org/14-journal.org/g; s/13-notebook\\.org/16-notebook.org/g; s/16-projectile\\.org/17-projectile.org/g; s/11-database-search\\.org/18-database-search.org/g; s/12-references\\.org/19-references.org/g; s/21-editmarks\\.org/20-editmarks.org/g; s/17-navigation\\.org/21-navigation.org/g; s/18-hydra-menus\\.org/22-hydra-menus.org/g; s/19-speed-commands\\.org/23-speed-commands.org/g; s/20-keybindings\\.org/24-keybindings.org/g; s/24-org-api\\.org/27-org-api.org/g' "$f")
